intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis ferdinandiana, commonly known as the Ferdinand's orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its compact, sympodial growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and yellow, often with a subtle greenish tinge. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, acidic soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
